contextId.information: These nominal adjectives can be stated as adjectives. AT: "those who are wicked ... those who are treacherous" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
This refers to poor people. AT: "those who are poor" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
This refers to wicked people. AT: "those who are wicked" or "the wicked people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
This nominal adjective can be translated as a noun phrase. AT: "a diligent man" or "a man who works hard" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
This nominal adjective can be translated as a noun phrase. AT: "wise person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
The nominal adjective "wicked" can be translated as a noun phrase. AT: "the wicked person" or "wicked people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
This nominal adjective can be translated as a noun phrase. AT: "perverse people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
This nominal adjective can be translated as a noun phrase. AT: "any poor person" or "poor people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
This refers to upright persons in general. AT: "upright persons" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
This refers to poor people in general. AT: "poor people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
